p: The free radical scavenging activities of herbal teas and methanol extracts were determined by DPPH and ABTS assays ( Table 3). All extracts showed significant antioxidant activity performing 30–64% inhibition at DPPH assay (50 μg/mL), as well as 26–48% inhibition at ABTS assay (10 μg/mL). The herbal tea KN3 performed the higher inhibition at DPPH (64.7%) and at ABTS (46.9%) which is in accordance with the high TPC. Also, the methanol extracts of KN1 and KN3 showed high inhibition.
